subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy
msgSnippet: ... Yee-ha! Take care. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software that people understand. http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
messageBody:
>So said Kris Henderson on 2003-07-31 --------------------
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Adam Jack [mailto:ajack@...]
>> Sent: Wednesday, July 30, 2003 6:08 PM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy
>>
>> I am saying "if my fruit class fails why bother
>> testing my apple class? It has a rotten core." It kinda goes
>> back to Bertrand Russell... If I know fruit is bad, then the
>> fact that apple succeeds doesn't make it a healthy apple, it
>> is unknown.
>
>
>If fruit is bad wouldn't you expect apple to be bad also? If apple
>succeeds and it uses fruit (which is bad) then succeeding apple tests
>might point to a problem in apple. So it may be useful for apple tests
>to run even though the fruit tests failed.

Yee-ha!

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
